alert.note: Alert for Malheur County; Oregon Lower Treasure Valley (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 08 at 4:31PM PDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Ada, southwestern Payette, Canyon, northwestern Owyhee, southwestern Gem and northeastern Malheur Counties through 600 PM MDT... At 529 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Keeney Pass to Elephant Butte to Silver City. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Elephant Butte and Adrian around 530 PM MDT. Marsing, Homedale, Keeney Pass and Givens Hot Springs around 540 PM MDT. Parma, Nyssa, Reynolds and Greenleaf around 550 PM MDT. Ontario, Nampa, Caldwell and Payette around 600 PM MDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Malheur County; Oregon Lower Treasure Valley
